titleStmt.title: Bridge Phase 2: Witness fMS, Collation unit C11

body.ab:
<lb n="c56-0057__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c56-0057.02" unit="tei:head"/>Ch V– 113<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0057__main__2"/> He
then put the following letter
<lb n="c56-0057__main__3"/>
into my hands.
<lb n="c56-0057__main__4"/>
"To
V.
Frankenstien <lb n="c56-0057__main__5"/> Geneva <del loc="c56-0057__main__d1e10384__Start"/>Apri<del loc="c56-0057__main__d1e10384__End"/>March 18th 17— <lb n="c56-0057__main__6"/> "My
dear
Cousin<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0057__main__7"/> "I
cannot describe to you
the
uneasi<lb n="c56-0058__main__1"/>ness we have all felt concerning your
<lb n="c56-0058__main__2"/>
health. We cannot help imagining that
<lb n="c56-0058__main__3"/>
your
friend Clerval conceals the ex<lb n="c56-0058__main__4"/>tent of your
disorder,
for it is now
<lb n="c56-0058__main__5"/>
several months since we have seen
<lb n="c56-0058__main__6"/>
your
handwriting
and all this
time
<lb n="c56-0058__main__7"/>
you
have
been obliged to dictate
to <lb n="c56-0058__main__8"/> Henry – Surely Victor
you must
have
<lb n="c56-0058__main__9"/>
been
very illand
this makes us
very
wretched
as much so
<metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0058.01">X</metamark><lb n="c56-0058__left_margin__1"/>
nearly as
<lb n="c56-0058__left_margin__2"/>
after the death
<lb n="c56-0058__left_margin__3"/>
of
your dear
<lb n="c56-0058__left_margin__4"/>
mother.
My father was almost <lb n="c56-0058__main__10"/> persuaded <del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10461__Start"/>of this<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10461__End"/>that you were indeed dangerously ill, and could hardly <lb n="c56-0058__main__11"/>be restrained
from
<metamark function="insert">߶</metamark>undertaking a journey
to
Ingolstadt. <lb n="c56-0058__main__12"/><del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10493__Start"/>I<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10493__End"/><del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10497__Start"/>but I entreated him not<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10497__End"/><del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10499__Start"/>to undertake it<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10499__End"/><del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10503__Start"/>because<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10503__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10511__Start"/>for<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10511__End"/><lb n="c56-0058__main__13"/><del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10517__Start"/>although<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10517__End"/>his health
is
better now <lb n="c56-0058__main__14"/> than it has been since
the
death <lb n="c56-0058__main__15"/> of My beloved Aunt, yet <del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10535__Start"/>tha<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10535__End"/>the fatigue <lb n="c56-0058__main__16"/> might have<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10549__Start"/>make him very ill<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10549__End"/><del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10552__Start"/>and<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10552__End"/><lb n="c56-0058__main__17"/>
Clerval
always
writes that
you
<lb n="c56-0058__main__18"/> were
getting
better <del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10571__Start"/>and<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10571__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>I <del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10580__Start"/>arden<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10580__End"/>
eagerly hope
you
<lb n="c56-0058__main__19"/>
will confirm
thisintelligence
soon in your own
<lb n="c56-0058__main__20"/> handwriting
for indeed,
indeed Victor <lb n="c56-0058__main__21"/>
we are all very
<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10597__Start"/>uneasy<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10597__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>miserable
on this account. Relieve
<lb n="c56-0058__main__22"/>
us from this
fear
and
we shall
<lb n="c56-0058__main__23"/>
be the happiest creatures in the
<lb n="c56-0058__main__24"/> world.– My uncles
health
<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10614__Start"/>impro<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10614__End"/>
is
<lb n="c56-0058__main__25"/>
now
<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10622__Start"/>well &<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10622__End"/><del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10625__Start"/>far<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10625__End"/> vigorous
that
he appears
<lb n="c56-0058__main__26"/>
ten years younger since last
<lb n="c56-0058__main__27"/>
winter. Ernest also is so much im<lb n="c56-0058__main__28"/>proved,
<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10642__Start"/>so<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10642__End"/>
that
you would
hardly
<lb n="c56-0058__main__29"/>
know
him;
he is now
nearly
sixteen <lb n="c56-0058__main__30"/> you know
and
has
<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10650__Start"/>quite<del loc="c56-0058__main__d1e10650__End"/>
lost that<lb n="c56-0059__main__1"/> sickly appearance
that
he had
<lb n="c56-0059__main__2"/>
some years
ago –
he is
quite
well &hearty<lb n="c56-0059__main__3"/> if I <del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10667__Start"/>y<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10667__End"/> may use that term for it is <lb n="c56-0059__main__4"/> very expressive.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0059__main__5"/> "My
uncle
and
I conversed
<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10677__Start"/>the<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10677__End"/><lb n="c56-0059__main__6"/> last night
a long time
about what
<lb n="c56-0059__main__7"/><lb n="c56-0059__left_margin__1"/> professionErnest
<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10693__Start"/>should
be<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10693__End"/>should
follow.
His
constant
<lb n="c56-0059__main__8"/> ill health
when young has deprived
<lb n="c56-0059__main__9"/><lb n="c56-0059__left_margin__1"/> himof
the
habit
of
application
and now
<lb n="c56-0059__main__10"/>
that
he
enjoys good
health <del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10714__Start"/>we<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10714__End"/>
he
<lb n="c56-0059__main__11"/>
is
continually
in the open
air <del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10719__Start"/>on<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10719__End"/><lb n="c56-0059__main__12"/>
climbing the
hills
or rowing on the
<lb n="c56-0059__main__13"/>
lake.
I, therefore,
proposed
that
<lb n="c56-0059__main__14"/>
he
shouldbe
a
farmer
which you
<lb n="c56-0059__main__15"/> know cousin
is a favourite scheme
<lb n="c56-0059__main__16"/>
of
mine –A farmer's
is a very healthy
<lb n="c56-0059__main__17"/><del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10737__Start"/>&<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10737__End"/>
happy life;
and
the least
hurtful <lb n="c56-0059__main__18"/>
or rather
the
most
benificial
<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10743__Start"/>of
any<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10743__End"/><lb n="c56-0059__main__19"/> profession.<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>of
any. My
<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10758__Start"/>father<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10758__End"/>
uncle had an
<lb n="c56-0059__main__20"/>
idea of his
being<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>educated
as an advocate, that through
<lb n="c56-0059__main__21"/>
his
interresthe
might become a judge.
But
besides that
<lb n="c56-0059__main__22"/>
he
is not at all
fit
for such an
<lb n="c56-0059__main__23"/>
occupation, it is certainly
<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10792__Start"/>better<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10792__End"/>more <del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10797__Start"/>honourable<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10797__End"/>creditable to
<lb n="c56-0059__main__24"/><del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10805__Start"/>to<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10805__End"/> cultivate the earth for the suste<lb n="c56-0059__main__25"/>nance of
man
than
<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10815__Start"/>it<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10815__End"/>
to be the
<lb n="c56-0059__main__26"/> confidant
& sometimes
<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10828__Start"/>a helpmate<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10828__End"/>the accomplice
of
<lb n="c56-0059__main__27"/><del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10839__Start"/>their<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10839__End"/>his
vices; which is the
employment<metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0059.03">^</metamark><lb n="c56-0059__left_margin__1"/>&<lb n="c56-0059__main__28"/>
of a Lawyer.
And if he should become <lb n="c56-0059__main__29"/> a judge
I
said
that
<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10870__Start"/>rich<del loc="c56-0059__main__d1e10870__End"/>the occupation
of a prosperous
farmer <lb n="c56-0059__main__30"/>
if
it
were not a more
honourable<lb n="c56-0060__main__1"/> it was
at least a happier
employ <lb n="c56-0060__main__2"/> ment
than that of a judge, whose
<lb n="c56-0060__main__3"/>
misfortune it was always to meddle
<lb n="c56-0060__main__4"/>
with the dark side of human
nature <lb n="c56-0060__main__5"/>
My
uncle
smiled
and
said
that
I
<lb n="c56-0060__main__6"/><del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10897__Start"/>ougt<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10897__End"/>
ought to be an advocate
myself; <lb n="c56-0060__main__7"/>
which put an end to the conversation
<lb n="c56-0060__main__8"/>
on that
subject<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0060__main__9"/> And
now I must tell you a little
<lb n="c56-0060__main__10"/>
story that will
please
you.
Do you
<lb n="c56-0060__main__11"/>
not
remember
<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10916__Start"/>Ju<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10916__End"/>
Justine
<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10919__Start"/>Martin<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10919__End"/>?<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__1"/>Moritz?<lb n="c56-0060__main__12"/> Perhaps
you do
not
I will
therefore <lb n="c56-0060__main__13"/> tell you
her
story
in a few words.
Mad. <lb n="c56-0060__main__14"/> Martin
her
Mother
was a widow with
<lb n="c56-0060__main__15"/>
four
children
of whom
<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10938__Start"/>this<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10938__End"/>
Justine
<lb n="c56-0060__main__16"/>
was the third. This girl had always been
<lb n="c56-0060__main__17"/>
the
<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10946__Start"/>favou<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10946__End"/>
favourite of her
father <lb n="c56-0060__main__18"/><del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10952__Start"/>and<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10952__End"/><lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__1"/>butthro an odd perversity
her Mother
<lb n="c56-0060__main__19"/><del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10967__Start"/>never<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10967__End"/>
could
<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10972__Start"/>bear<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10972__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>not
endure
her and
after the
<lb n="c56-0060__main__20"/>
death of M.
<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10988__Start"/>Martin<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10988__End"/>Moritz
treated her very ill.
<lb n="c56-0060__main__21"/>
My aunt observed
this, and
when Justine
<lb n="c56-0060__main__22"/>
was
<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10999__Start"/>ten<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e10999__End"/>
twelve years
old too
prevailed
<lb n="c56-0060__main__23"/>
on her mother to allow her to live
<lb n="c56-0060__main__24"/>
at
our
house.<metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0060.03">X</metamark><lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__1"/><metamark function="displacement">X</metamark><lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__2"/>
The republican
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__3"/>
institutions of our
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__4"/><del loc="c56-0060__left_margin__d1e11025__Start"/>state<del loc="c56-0060__left_margin__d1e11025__End"/> country,
have
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__5"/>
produced simpler <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__6"/>& happier manners
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__7"/>
than those which
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__8"/>
prevail in the
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__9"/>
great monarchies
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__10"/>
that surround it.
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__11"/><del loc="c56-0060__left_margin__d1e11043__Start"/>Ju Whilst<del loc="c56-0060__left_margin__d1e11043__End"/><lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__12"/>
Hence there
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__13"/>
is less
dis<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__1"/> tinction<del loc="c56-0060__left_margin__d1e11058__Start"/>s<del loc="c56-0060__left_margin__d1e11058__End"/>
between
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__2"/>
the
classes
into <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__3"/> which human <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__4"/> beings have <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__5"/> been divided,
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__6"/>& the lower
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__7"/>
orders being
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__8"/>
neither so poor
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__9"/>
nor so
despised <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__10"/>
are more
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__11"/>
refined & moral.
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__12"/>
A servant
at <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__13"/>
Geneva does
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__14"/>
not mean the
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__15"/>
same thing as
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__16"/>
a servant in
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__17"/>
France
or England <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__18"/> —Justine <del loc="c56-0060__left_margin__d1e11099__Start"/>was<del loc="c56-0060__left_margin__d1e11099__End"/><lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__19"/>
thus
recieved into <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__20"/>
our
family to <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__21"/> learn
the duties
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__22"/>
of a
servant, which <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__23"/>
in our fortunate
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__24"/> country
does not
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__25"/>
include
a
sacri<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__26"/>fize
of the digni<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__27"/>ty of a human
<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__28"/> being.<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e11136__Start"/>Where<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e11136__End"/>she was taught <lb n="c56-0060__main__25"/> all the duties of servant & was very <lb n="c56-0060__main__26"/> kindly treated.
I dare say
that
you
now <lb n="c56-0060__main__27"/>
remember
all about it,
for Justine
<lb n="c56-0060__main__28"/>
was a great favourite of
yours,
& I
<lb n="c56-0060__main__29"/><del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e11155__Start"/>remember<del loc="c56-0060__main__d1e11155__End"/>recollect
you once
said,
that<lb n="c56-0061__main__1"/> if you were
<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11170__Start"/>a<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11170__End"/>
in an
ill
humour <lb n="c56-0061__main__2"/>
one glance from
Justine,
could dissi<lb n="c56-0061__main__3"/>pate
it <del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11184__Start"/>from<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11184__End"/>for
the same reason
<lb n="c56-0061__main__4"/>
that Ariosto
gave
concerning the
<lb n="c56-0061__main__5"/>
beauty of
Angelica:– she
looked so
<lb n="c56-0061__main__6"/> frank hearted
and happy. My Aunt
<lb n="c56-0061__main__7"/><del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11199__Start"/>was very fond of her which<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11199__End"/><del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11202__Start"/>caused<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11202__End"/>concieved an
attachment for her, by which she
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>wasinduced<lb n="c56-0061__main__8"/><del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11221__Start"/>her to<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11221__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>to
give her
an<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11235__Start"/>d<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11235__End"/>
education
<lb n="c56-0061__main__9"/>
superior to that which she
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>had
at
<lb n="c56-0061__main__10"/>
first
intended.<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11257__Start"/>and she<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11257__End"/>This
benefit was fully
<lb n="c56-0061__main__11"/>
repaid;
<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11267__Start"/>for<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11267__End"/>
Justine was the most
<lb n="c56-0061__main__12"/>
grateful little creature in the
<lb n="c56-0061__main__13"/> world.
I do not mean that she
<lb n="c56-0061__main__14"/>
made any
professions–I
never
<lb n="c56-0061__main__15"/>
heard one pass her
lips <del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11279__Start"/>w<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11279__End"/>
but
<lb n="c56-0061__main__16"/>
you could see by her
eye
that
<lb n="c56-0061__main__17"/>
she almost adored her protectress.
<lb n="c56-0061__main__18"/>
Although
very
gay, and in many respects
<lb n="c56-0061__main__19"/>
inconsiderate, yet she paid
the greatest
<lb n="c56-0061__main__20"/>
attention to every gesture of my
Aunt– <lb n="c56-0061__main__21"/>
she thought her the
<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11297__Start"/>miracle<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11297__End"/>model
of
all<lb n="c56-0061__main__22"/><del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11308__Start"/>perfection<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11308__End"/>excellence,
and endeavoured to imi<lb n="c56-0061__main__23"/>tate her
words
and
even her
man<lb n="c56-0061__main__24"/>ners, so that
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>even
now she
<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11338__Start"/>very<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11338__End"/>
often
<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11343__Start"/>puts<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11343__End"/><lb n="c56-0061__left_margin__1"/>reminds<lb n="c56-0061__main__25"/>
me
<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11356__Start"/>in mind<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11356__End"/>
of
her. <del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11361__Start"/>You did not<del loc="c56-0061__main__d1e11361__End"/> observe <lb n="c56-0061__main__26"/> all this, nor did I at the time but <lb n="c56-0061__main__27"/> it struck me afterwards when I <lb n="c56-0061__main__28"/> reflected on the subject.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0061__main__29"/> When
my dearest Aunt
died
every
<lb n="c56-0061__main__30"/>
one was too much occupied in their<lb n="c56-0062__main__1"/> own
<del loc="c56-0062__main__d1e11385__Start"/>grif<del loc="c56-0062__main__d1e11385__End"/>
grief to notice poor
Justine <lb n="c56-0062__main__2"/>
who had attended her during her
<del loc="c56-0062__main__d1e11390__Start"/>whole<del loc="c56-0062__main__d1e11390__End"/><lb n="c56-0062__main__3"/>
illness with the
greatest
affection.
<lb n="c56-0062__main__4"/>
Poor Justine was very
ill
but other
<lb n="c56-0062__main__5"/> tryals
were reserved for
her.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0062__main__6"/> One
by
one
her brothers & sister
<lb n="c56-0062__main__7"/> had died
and her
mother was now <lb n="c56-0062__main__8"/>
with the exception of her neglected
<lb n="c56-0062__main__9"/> daugher
<del loc="c56-0062__main__d1e11411__Start"/>was<del loc="c56-0062__main__d1e11411__End"/> left childless. The
<lb n="c56-0062__main__10"/>
conscience of the woman was
troubled <lb n="c56-0062__main__11"/> and
she began to think that the
<lb n="c56-0062__main__12"/>
deaths of her favourites was a
judgement <lb n="c56-0062__main__13"/>sentfrom
heaven to
<del loc="c56-0062__main__d1e11427__Start"/>punish<del loc="c56-0062__main__d1e11427__End"/>chastise
her
partiallity <lb n="c56-0062__main__14"/>
she was a roman
Catholic
and I believe
<lb n="c56-0062__main__15"/>
her confessor
encouraged
the
idea<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>which
she had
concieved..
Accor<lb n="c56-0062__main__16"/>dingly, a few Months after your depar<lb n="c56-0062__main__17"/>ture for Ingolstadt,
<del loc="c56-0062__main__d1e11474__Start"/>sh<del loc="c56-0062__main__d1e11474__End"/>
Justine was called
<lb n="c56-0062__main__18"/>
home by her repentant Mother. Poor
<lb n="c56-0062__main__19"/> girl
she wept when she quitted our
house <lb n="c56-0062__main__20"/>
she was much altered since the death
<lb n="c56-0062__main__21"/>
of my
aunt:
grief had given softness
<lb n="c56-0062__main__22"/>
and a winning mildness to her
manners <lb n="c56-0062__main__23"/>
which had before been remarkable
<lb n="c56-0062__main__24"/>
for vivacity. Nor
<del loc="c56-0062__main__d1e11498__Start"/>did<del loc="c56-0062__main__d1e11498__End"/>
was her residence
<lb n="c56-0062__main__25"/>
at her
Mothers
house of a nature to
<lb n="c56-0062__main__26"/>
restore her gaiety. The poor
<del loc="c56-0062__main__d1e11506__Start"/>fo<del loc="c56-0062__main__d1e11506__End"/> wo <lb n="c56-0062__main__27"/> man
was very vacillating in her
<lb n="c56-0062__main__28"/>
repentance. She sometimes begged
<lb n="c56-0062__main__29"/>
Justine to forgive her
unkindness<lb n="c56-0063__main__1"/>
but much
oftenor
accused her
<lb n="c56-0063__main__2"/> as
having caused the deaths of
<del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11524__Start"/>h<del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11524__End"/>
her
<lb n="c56-0063__main__3"/>
brothers & sister. Perpetual fretting
<lb n="c56-0063__main__4"/>
at
last
threw
Mad. Martin
into
<lb n="c56-0063__main__5"/>
a decline, which at first
encreased <lb n="c56-0063__main__6"/>
her irritability, but she is now at
<lb n="c56-0063__main__7"/> rest
for
ever; <del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11541__Start"/>for<del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11541__End"/><del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11544__Start"/>S<del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11544__End"/>
she
<del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11549__Start"/>did<del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11549__End"/>
died
<lb n="c56-0063__main__8"/>
on the first approach of cold
at
<lb n="c56-0063__main__9"/>
the beginning of
this<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>last winter that <lb n="c56-0063__main__10"/> has just passed.
Justine has
<lb n="c56-0063__main__11"/>
returned to
us
and I assure you
<lb n="c56-0063__main__12"/>
I love her tenderly. She is very clever
<lb n="c56-0063__main__13"/>
and
extremely mild
&
pretty and
as
<lb n="c56-0063__main__14"/>
I mentioned
before <del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11588__Start"/>she<del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11588__End"/><del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11591__Start"/>is<del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11591__End"/>
her
<del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11596__Start"/>air<del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11596__End"/>mein
and <lb n="c56-0063__main__15"/><lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__1"/>her expressions
<del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11611__Start"/>are<del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11611__End"/>
continually remind me
<lb n="c56-0063__main__16"/>
of my dear
Aunt.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0063__main__17"/><del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11620__Start"/>And<del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11620__End"/> I
must say
a few words to
<lb n="c56-0063__main__18"/> you also,
My dear
Victor,
of little darling
<lb n="c56-0063__main__19"/>
William. I wish you could see
him.
He
<lb n="c56-0063__main__20"/>
is very tall of his
age
with sweet laughing
<lb n="c56-0063__main__21"/>
blue
eyes <del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11632__Start"/>and<del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11632__End"/>
dark
eyelashes
and curling
<lb n="c56-0063__main__22"/> hair
When he
smiles
two little dimples
<lb n="c56-0063__main__23"/>
appear on
his cheeks
which are rosy
<lb n="c56-0063__main__24"/>
with
health — his chin comes down in <lb n="c56-0063__main__25"/> a beautiful oval <del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11644__Start"/>a<del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11644__End"/> After this descrip<lb n="c56-0063__main__26"/>tion I can only say what our visitors <lb n="c56-0063__main__27"/> say a thousand times a day–'He is too <lb n="c56-0063__main__28"/> pretty for a boy'.<metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0063.03">X</metamark><lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__1"/>
He has already
<lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__2"/>
had one or two
<lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__3"/>
little
wives<lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__4"/>
but Louisa
<lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__5"/><del loc="c56-0063__left_margin__d1e11680__Start"/>Caln<del loc="c56-0063__left_margin__d1e11680__End"/>
Biron <lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__6"/>is his
favourite– <lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__7"/>
a pretty little
<lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__8"/>
girl of five years
old <milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0063__main__29"/><del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11698__Start"/>Miss Mansfeld<del loc="c56-0063__main__d1e11698__End"/> Now,
dear
Victor
I dare<lb n="c56-0064__main__1"/> say
<del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11708__Start"/>I<del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11708__End"/>
you wish to be indulged in a little
<lb n="c56-0064__main__2"/>
gossip
about your acquaintance.
The
<lb n="c56-0064__main__3"/>
pretty Miss
Mansfeld
has already received
<lb n="c56-0064__main__4"/><del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11716__Start"/>on<del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11716__End"/><del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11720__Start"/>her<del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11720__End"/>
the congratulatory visits on her
<lb n="c56-0064__main__5"/>
approaching marriage with a young
<lb n="c56-0064__main__6"/>
Englishman, John
<del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11727__Start"/>Mebourne<del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11727__End"/>Mel<lb n="c56-0064__main__7"/>bourne
Esq. Her ugly
sister Manon <lb n="c56-0064__main__8"/>
married M.
Hofland
the rich
banker
last
<lb n="c56-0064__main__9"/>
autumn. Your favourite
schoolfellow <lb n="c56-0064__main__10"/>
Louis
Manoir <del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11743__Start"/>ma<del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11743__End"/>
has suffered several
<lb n="c56-0064__main__11"/>
misfortunes
<del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11749__Start"/>d<del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11749__End"/>
since the departure
<lb n="c56-0064__main__12"/>
of Clerval from
Geneva <del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11754__Start"/>b<del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11754__End"/>
But he
<lb n="c56-0064__main__13"/>
has
<del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11759__Start"/>atready<del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11759__End"/>
already recovered his
spirits <lb n="c56-0064__main__14"/>
and
he
reported to
<del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11765__Start"/>m<del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11765__End"/>
be on the point
<lb n="c56-0064__main__15"/>
of marrying a very lively pretty
french <lb n="c56-0064__main__16"/> woman— Mad. Tavernier –She
is a
widow <lb n="c56-0064__main__17"/>
and much older than
Manoir
but
<lb n="c56-0064__main__18"/>
she is
much
<del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11776__Start"/>adv<del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11776__End"/> admired
and a
<lb n="c56-0064__main__19"/>
favourite with
every
body.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0064__main__20"/> I
have written myself into
good
spi<lb n="c56-0064__main__21"/>rits, dear
Cousin
yet I
can not
conclude
<lb n="c56-0064__main__22"/>
without again anxiously
enquiring <lb n="c56-0064__main__23"/>
concerning your
health—
Dear Victor, if
<lb n="c56-0064__main__24"/>
you are not very
ill
write
yourself <lb n="c56-0064__main__25"/>
and make your father and all
<lb n="c56-0064__main__26"/>
of us
happy or— I
cannot bear to
<lb n="c56-0064__left_margin__1"/>
think
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>on
the
<lb n="c56-0064__left_margin__2"/>
other side
<lb n="c56-0064__left_margin__3"/>
of the
question <lb n="c56-0064__left_margin__4"/>
my tears al<lb n="c56-0064__left_margin__5"/>ready
flow<lb n="c56-0064__main__27"/> Your very affectionate Cousin <lb n="c56-0064__main__28"/><milestone next="#c56-0064.04" spanTo="#c56-0064.03" unit="tei:seg"/><del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11839__Start"/>dearrest<del loc="c56-0064__main__d1e11839__End"/> – dearest Victor<metamark function="separate">)</metamark> Elizabeth Lavenza <lb n="c56-0064__main__29"/><milestone spanTo="#c56-0064.05" unit="tei:seg" xml:id="c56-0064.04"/>write–
